column4: Hello. Running Jaunty with gnome on a dell studio xps16 with full hd 1920x1080....anyone has some good tips / links for font optimizing, especially in firefox ?
I know this is an issue for many people and I read and try a lot but for firefox I cannot come to a decent solution
system fonts are fine actually, but with full hd res, I cannot find any optimal font setting in firefox...
I am on an XPS m1130 and going to system->preferences->appearance and then going to the fonts section, choosing details and editing the DPI helps me
You install msttcorefonts?

thx, how many dpi you have ? In general I would be happy with firefox looking fine on all pages....but for example ubuntuforums look great with one font, with the same font last.fm is ugly and overlaps etc...so hard to find a perfect solution
yes installed corefonts
do you have option "allow websites to use own fonts" in firefox set?
ok. Could you please tell me your fonts used in Firefox / sizes ? Would be nice...
ok thx
same here, 16

will try further with fonts or else maybe with a standard set zoom for all websites in firefox....as websites might still be optimized for lower res these days...will try your posted settings with 16 right now...
I looked up the problem and some say that editing your appearance->font->details and setting hinting to none fixes things

just tried all, with your font settings in firefox, for example at me the login text overlaps with a formular field...if I go down with font size, its getting too small...so I tried different one, droid, bitstream, etc...still, seems Im unable to find a perfect firefox config that fits on all sites. Sure Im not an expert regarding fonts but I know this is common problem for many people....recently swit
did you try appearance->font->details and setting hinting to none?
Yes, just did that and restarted firefox
Firefox 3.0.10...yes you are right, its a problem related due to my high res....I was fine on 15inch notebooks
hmm, I think zoom could help here, small fonts but zoom like ctrl + works and looks fine...maybe you know the setting in firefox responsible for a standard zoom on every webpage set in about:config ?
yes, that works, just like to have a standard zoom for every page...but its ok I just google that, thx for your help

oh btw., if you have a studio, did you update your bios yet over ubuntu with the dell firmware tools ? seems like they dont post the updates for mine in their repo....and I cannot get a .hdr file from the win packages dell provides
fyi, looks better with hinting off
